header.description: Integration for WebSphere Message Broker to deploy Broker Archives and start and stop Message Flows using the CMP API. This plugin is compatible with both version 9 and 10 of IBM Integration Bus, and is also compatible with versions 7 and 8 of WebSphere Message Broker.

step-type.name: Set Integration Node Properties
step-type.description: Set Runtime Properties for the Integration Node (broker).

property-ui.label: Properties
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of properties to set in the format 'type:name=value'. Possible component types to specify for 'type' are configurableservice, httplistener, securitycache, cachemanager, or webadmin. The name is specified in the format 'objectName/propertyName'. For configurable services the name must be in the format 'service/objectName/propertyName'.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Use SSL
property-ui.description: Administration security authentication/authorization. This option is only available in IIB version 10.

property-ui.label: Integration Node Name
property-ui.description: Name of Integration Node (broker). You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Channel
property-ui.description: The name of the channel to use. Must be defined on the queue manager. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Queue Manager
property-ui.description: The WebSphere MQ Queue Manager which the broker is using. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Username
property-ui.description: Username for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Password
property-ui.description: Password for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Trace File
property-ui.description: The file to use for trace logging. If not set trace logging will be disabled.

property-ui.label: IBM Integration Bus Version
property-ui.description: Enter the version of the installed IBM Integration Bus. This determines which API will be required. For example: 10.0.0.1

property-ui.label: Jar Path
property-ui.description: Specify either a directory to recursively search from which contains all required jars, or specify each individual jar path split by your file systems path separator. For a list of required jar files please view the plugin documentation.

property-ui.label: MQSIPROFILE Executable
property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Create Execution Group
step-type.description: Create execution groups, but only if they do not exist.

property-ui.label: Execution Groups
property-ui.description: Comma or new line separated list of Execution Groups defined on the broker to create if they do not exist.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.description: Administration security authentication/authorization. This option is only available in IIB version 10.

property-ui.label: Integration Node Name
property-ui.description: Name of Integration Node. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.description: The name of the channel to use. Must be defined on the queue manager. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Queue Manager
property-ui.description: The WebSphere MQ Queue Manager which the broker is using. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Username
property-ui.description: Username for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Password
property-ui.description: Password for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Trace File
property-ui.description: The file to use for trace logging. If not set trace logging will be disabled.

property-ui.label: IBM Integration Bus Version
property-ui.description: Enter the version of the installed IBM Integration Bus. This determines which API will be required. For example: 10.0.0.1

property-ui.description: Specify either a directory to recursively search from which contains all required jars, or specify each individual jar path split by your file systems path separator. For a list of required jar files please view the plugin documentation.

property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Does Execution Group Exist
step-type.description: Sets an output property named 'exists' with true or false based on the existence of the specified Execution Group.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Execution Group name to identify its existence.

property-ui.label: Fail if Execution Group Not Found
property-ui.description: Select this checkbox to fail the step if the Execution Group is not found. The output property will still be set.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

step-type.name: Restart Execution Groups
step-type.description: Restart execution groups if they exist on the broker.

property-ui.label: Execution Groups
property-ui.description: Comma or new line separated list of Execution Groups defined on the broker to restart.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.description: Administration security authentication/authorization. This option is only available in IIB version 10.

property-ui.label: Jar Path
property-ui.description: Specify either a directory to recursively search from which contains all required jars, or specify each individual jar path split by your file systems path separator. For a list of required jar files please view the plugin documentation.

property-ui.label: MQSIPROFILE Executable
property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB, and the maximum amount of time to wait for the server to stop/start. Leave empty or use -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang. Increase if experiencing 'ConfigManagerProxyRequestTimoutException', or if the execution group was unable to stop by the given time interval.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Delete Execution Group
step-type.description: Delete the specified execution group from the broker. This will also remove any resources used by the execution group.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: The name of the execution group to be deleted.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

step-type.name: Set Execution Group Properties
step-type.description: Set runtime properties for an execution group.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Name of the Execution Group defined on the broker.

property-ui.label: Properties
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of properties to set in the format name=value

step-type.name: Set Message Flows Properties
step-type.description: Sets runtime properties on a list of message flows.

property-ui.label: Directory Offset
property-ui.description: Path under the current working directory where you want the step to execute. Absolute paths are not allowed.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Name of the Execution Group to Deploy to.

property-ui.label: Message Flows
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of message flows.

property-ui.label: Properties
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of properties to set in the format name=value

property-ui.label: Property File
property-ui.description: Specify the name and path to a property file to use as a source of the properties instead of explicitly listing the properties in the Properties field and the flows in the Message Flows field. The property file would be the same format as the one used by the mqsiapplybaroverride command.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

step-type.name: Delete BAR File Contents
step-type.description: Delete all contents that have been deployed using a BAR file name that matches the given regular expression. Useful for deploying into shared execution groups.

property-ui.label: RegEx
property-ui.description: Java compliant regular expression for matching the BAR file name of deployed flows.

property-ui.label: Delete Libraries
property-ui.description: Check this box to delete any libraries that have been deployed to the execution group using the BAR file.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Name of the Execution Group to Deploy to.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

step-type.name: Delete Applications
step-type.description: Delete an application or multiple applications deployed to an execution group by name.

property-ui.label: Application Names
property-ui.description: A list of IIB application names split by newlines or commas.

property-ui.label: Fail On Missing Application
property-ui.description: Select this checkbox to fail immediately if any specified applications do not exist on the execution group. Otherwise, the step will only fail if none of the applications exist on the execution group.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Name of the Execution Group where the applications exist.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Create Or Update Configurable Service
step-type.description: Create a configurable service if it doesn't exist. If it does, update its properties.

property-ui.label: Service Name
property-ui.description: The name of the service to be created or updated

property-ui.label: Service Type
property-ui.description: The type of the service. If there is a service matching Service Name that is not of this type, the step will fail.

property-ui.label: Properties
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of properties to set in the format name->value or name=value

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Use SSL
property-ui.description: Administration security authentication/authorization. This option is only available in IIB version 10.

property-ui.label: Delete Missing Properties
property-ui.description: This option will attempt to delete any properties that exist on the configurable service that aren't referenced in the 'Properties' field.

property-ui.label: Integration Node Name
property-ui.description: Name of Integration Node. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Channel
property-ui.description: The name of the channel to use. Must be defined on the queue manager. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Queue Manager
property-ui.description: The WebSphere MQ Queue Manager which the broker is using. Specify this value if you are using below version 10 of IIB.

property-ui.label: Username
property-ui.description: Username for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Password
property-ui.description: Password for secure authentication. Explicit user authentication only available with IIB 10.

property-ui.label: Trace File
property-ui.description: The file to use for trace logging. If not set trace logging will be disabled.

property-ui.label: IBM Integration Bus Version
property-ui.description: Enter the version of the installed IBM Integration Bus. This determines which API will be required. For example: 10.0.0.1

property-ui.label: Jar Path
property-ui.description: Specify either a directory to recursively search from which contains all required jars, or specify each individual jar path split by your file systems path separator. For a list of required jar files please view the plugin documentation.

property-ui.label: MQSIPROFILE Executable
property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Deploy
step-type.description: Deploy a Broker Archive. This step will set the output property 'completionCode', representing the last completion code returned from the broker during deployment.

property-ui.label: Bar File Names
property-ui.description: Comma or new line separated list of Broker Archive files to deploy.

property-ui.label: Execution Groups
property-ui.description: Comma or new line separated list of Execution Groups to Deploy to.

property-ui.label: Deployment Type
property-ui.description: Specify either an incremental or full deployment. You may specify the '${p?:iib.deployType}' option and set the 'iib.deployType' property to either 'incremental' or 'full' at any level in the property hierarchy.

property-ui.label: Start/Stop Message Flows
property-ui.description: Check to stop all Message Flows in the Execution Group before deployment and start all Message Flows after deployment.

property-ui.label: IP
property-ui.description: The ip address of the target server for a remote connection. You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

property-ui.label: Port
property-ui.description: The port of the target server for a remote connection.You must specify either an 'IP' and 'Port' to connect to a remote broker or an 'Integration Node Name' to connect to a local broker.

step-type.name: Start Message Flows
step-type.description: Start Message Flows that are stopped.

property-ui.label: Execution Group
property-ui.description: Name of the Execution Group.

property-ui.label: Message Flows
property-ui.description: Comma or new line separated list of Message Flow names to start.

property-ui.label: IP

property-ui.label: MQSIPROFILE Executable
property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Override Bar Properties
step-type.description: Overrides configuration properties inside a Broker Archive file. This step is not compatible with WebSphere Message Broker version 7.

property-ui.label: Bar File Includes
property-ui.description: New line separated list of broker archive files or patterns to include *.bar includes all bar files in the working directory.

property-ui.label: Bar File Excludes
property-ui.description: New line separated list of Broker Archives to exclude *.bar includes all bar files in the working directory.

property-ui.label: Properties
property-ui.description: A new line separated list of properties to set in the format name=value, or a Property file. (You must specify either Properties or a Properties File, not both)

property-ui.label: IBM Integration Bus Version
property-ui.description: Enter the version of the installed IBM Integration Bus. This determines which API will be required. For example: 10.0.0.1

property-ui.label: Jar Path
property-ui.description: Specify either a directory to recursively search from which contains all required jars, or specify each individual jar path split by your file systems path separator. For a list of required jar files please view the plugin documentation.

property-ui.label: On Failure
property-ui.description: Choice of action when overrides fail on a particular bar file. (Fast Fail: Step will fail right away. Best Effort: Step will attempt to override properties on all bar files, and will fail at the end if any override failures occurred. Useful to pinpoint which bar files are invalid. Warn: Step will continue on if an override failure occurs, and print a warning declaring the bar file that failed.)

property-ui.label: MQSIPROFILE Executable
property-ui.description: The absolute path to the mqsiprofile executable on your IIB server. Specifying this value will initialize your command environment. This value is required if your command environment is not initialized on startup through a script such as `.bashrc`.

property-ui.label: Environment Variables
property-ui.description: A file or list containing property entries, with each entry delimited by newlines. Entries must be in the form 'VAR=VALUE' (i.e. java.library.path=/opt/mqm/java/lib64: /opt/mqm/java/lib). Implemented to support z/OS using an ENVFILE.

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a response from WebSphere IIB. Increase if experiencing Timeout Exceptions. Leave empty or set to -1 to wait indefinitely. Note: Setting the timeout as -1 may cause the step to hang.

property-ui.label: Shell
property-ui.description: Path to your shell executable file.

step-type.name: Create Integration Node
step-type.description: Create an Integration Node (Broker). This command will create the WebSphere MQ queues required by the broker if they don't already exist.

property-ui.label: IIB Installation Directory
property-ui.description: The installation directory of the IIB server. (e.g. /opt/ibm/server)

property-ui.label: Integration Node (Broker)
property-ui.description: The name of the integration node to create.

property-ui.label: Queue Manager
property-ui.description: The name of your WebSphere MQ Queue Manager. If this is not specified a queue manager is created unless running z/OS, in which case this step will fail.

property-ui.label: Service User ID
property-ui.description: The user ID under which the broker runs. This is only required for IIB version 9.

property-ui.label: Service Password
property-ui.description: The password for the service user ID. This is only required for IIB version 9.

property-ui.label: Additional Arguments
property-ui.description: Any additional arguments to pass to the 'mqsicreatebroker' script when running this step. Multiple arguments are split by new line. (e.g. '-i generalDefaultUserId')

step-type.name: Delete Integration Node

property-ui.label: IIB Installation Directory
property-ui.description: The installation directory of the IIB server. (e.g. /opt/ibm/server)

property-ui.label: Integration Node (Broker)
property-ui.description: The name of the integration node to create.

property-ui.label: Delete WebSphere MQ Queues
property-ui.description: Check this box to delete any current integration server administration security WebSphere MQ queues along with the integration node.

property-ui.label: Delete Trace Files
property-ui.description: Check this box to delete the node's trace files from its work directory.

step-type.name: Start Integration Node

property-ui.label: IIB Installation Directory
property-ui.description: The installation directory of the IIB server. (e.g. /opt/ibm/server)

property-ui.label: Integration Node (Broker)
property-ui.description: The name of the integration node to create.

step-type.name: Stop Integration Node

property-ui.label: IIB Installation Directory
property-ui.description: The installation directory of the IIB server. (e.g. /opt/ibm/server)

property-ui.label: Integration Node (Broker)
property-ui.description: The name of the integration node to create.
